citations.narrative:
Three different pig enclosures and the large shelter for the goats have facility items that need to be addressed to keep the
area in good repair for the safety of the animals. These include:
*** A grey tarp in one enclosure that is chewed with frayed strings and edges that could be a hazard if ingested by the
pigs.
*** A chain link panel over a pig enclosure that is not secured to the support pipes. This could impact the structural
integrity of the top panel with a storm and cause it to come down into the enclosure. This top panel needs to be secured
for the safety of the pigs.
*** A door for the group of 5 pigs has a metal section that is pulling away from the door in the lower corner which has
sharp edges and could cause potential injury.
*** The metal siding on the shelter for the goats is broken and cracked in a few areas which has created sharp edges that
could potentially cause injury.
These areas of the enclosure must be maintained in good repair for the safety of the animals and to keep the enclosures
and shelters structurally sound.
Correct by: Feb 3, 2023

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
Although the facility provides enrichment to the birds, they do not have an environmental enhancement plan in place to
promote the overall psychological well-being of the birds at the facility. Exhibitors must develop, document, and follow a
species appropriate plan for environmental enhancement to promote the psychological well being of the birds that is
within industry standards and approved by the veterinarian. Additionally, this plan must address under 3.154 c(3) the
special considerations for the single housed rooster that does not have access to hear and see other bird species. The
plan must be made available for future inspections.
Correct by: Jan 31, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
